review.comment_positive:
Prachtig hotel voorzien van alle luxe. We werden uiterst vriendelijk welkom geheten. Het personeel was het hele verblijf enorm behulpzaam. Ze spraken goed Engels. Daarnaast hebben ze een bureau waar je geholpen wordt met reisinformatie. Ze hebben ons daar geholpen aan tickets voor de Fansipan kabelbaan en ook aan een nachtbus naar Ninh Binh, ookal was Ninh Binh voor het hotel geen gebruikelijke bestemming waar ze bij assisteren. Er werd echt extra moeite gedaan en dat vonden we enorm fijn. Complimenten aan het personeel. Uitmuntende service! Bedankt!

En dan vergeet ik nog dat we een gratis upgrade kregen en dat het uitzicht vanaf het balkon prachtig was over de vallei!

review.comment_positive: Pao's Sapa Leisure Hotel is located beautifully in front of one of Sapa's many valleys, looking at typical rice terraces and mountains. Besides very friendly and supportive staff, the hotel offers a nice restaurant and spa experience. The gym is also well equipped and offers enough equipment for a good workout. I'll be happy to visit again next time I'm around.

review.comment_positive:
The customer service was top range from the bell boys at the front entrance to the front desks reception. Quick and easy checkin. 

The hotel have a million dollar view, it so beautiful mountain and village view. Me and wife loved it surprised what we can see. Little disappointed we can see the sea of clouds in the morning but expected it and NO negative points are given to the hotel.

The room is big and have a nice clean big bathtub. It also have nice view from it.

review.comment_positive:
came from Hong Kong for 2 days in sapa as part of our 2 weeks trip in Vietnam.I believe paos is the best hotel in sapa for the price. quite please with the service and the facilities (donâ€™t forget we are in Vietnam and in the middle of the mountain). The view is stunning from the balcony and our bath tub.


the restaurant is also good and relatively affordable. 

the FO manager speak quite good English and really took care of us during our entire stay. 

only one downside is the trekking agency that they helped us book didnâ€™t really deliver on their promise. but the FO manager gave us a discount to make up for it which was much appreciated!
for people looking to trek I recommend fansipan instead of the small village (really tourist trap in my opinion)

review.comment_positive: We were greeted by Mr Tham at reception on arrival, and he was very good in explaining everything. As we had left our phone chargers behind, he offered to charge them for us which was great. Our room and view from the balcony were very nice looking over the mountains, Breakfast was excellent with lots of choice and a view over the valley as well. The free shuttle bus to town every 2 hours was a fantastic bonus. We booked our cable car to Fansipan and a massage which were both looked after by the lady at the tour desk at the hotel and she made sure everything went to plan, Overall a great stay, and we would recommend Pao's Sa Pa to our friends.
review.comment_negative: Our bed was a little firm for us but we still slept well.

review.comment_positive:
We had a wonderful stay at Pao's Sapa Leisure Hotel.  Very beautiful and stunning mountain and valley view.  All staff is very helpful and knowledgeable, Katie, Dinh and all others, including securitystaff outside at the parkinglot, whose names I can't remember.  It is a large hotel but the staff is able to provide personal attention.  They speak good English, which is nice for making contact.  They provide correct and reliable information. The restaurant serves very good breakfast and dinner.  The room is perfect.  It has everything you need and is also very clean.
Temperature at Sapa is very pleasant. There are lots of things to do. Even the Hmong ladies outside the hotels are also friendly and always smiling. 
Pao's Sapa Leisure Hotel is now on our favourite list of hotels. 
Next time we'll definitely come back to Pao's Sapa Leisure Hotel again.

Consiglio vivamente questo hotel a chiunque cerchi un soggiorno confortevole

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Cá»• Äiá»ƒn GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n
review.comment_positive:
The hotel is amazing! It has all the important facilities, from spa, to roof top, lounge areas, bar, etc. 
Staff was always prompt to answer our question/ give suggestions about where to go, very kind.
The view from the dinning area is simply amazing, breathtaking. The breakfast was one of the most complete I have ever seen (not just Asian but also western) everything for everyone! Tasty, fresh products well prepared. They also serve lunch and dinner in the hotel which is handy.
The room was very clean, spacious and with a nice balcony overlooking the rice fields! Amazing with all the toiletries etc! 
We loved it and we would love to comeback once visiting Sapa again!
review.comment_negative:
The pool was out of service for maintenance.
I did one full body massage and the environment did not have music and it is important for me to fully relax.

Besides, it was all amazing.

review.comment_positive: Beautiful views and quiet area as away from the centre of town. Free shuttle to and from town every 2hrs or a 15-20min walk uphill. We were upgraded as mentioned it was our honeymoon trip when booking, however there seemed to be some maintenance happening during our stay as there was a fair bit of banging above our room during daylight hours. Bed was MASSIVE and very comfortable. Bathroom was big, shower was amazing (especially after a day of hiking). Great buffet selection for breakfast.
review.comment_negative: Quite overpriced for what you get (especially for Vietnam). Wouldnâ€™t use the washing services as that cost us triple the price of every other time we used a washing service ($60AUD for a small wash). Room not very soundproof and we had a few nights where the people in the room next door were very loud in their room and the hallway (though I think this is more an issue of their bad etiquette than the soundproofing of the room itself).

Suite
review.comment_positive:
-The best 5-stared hotel in Sapa, I stayed in Mgallery several times and stayed here this time once again but disappointed so I moved to Pao.
-Location: Good, just a little bit far from the centre but they arrange free e-cab for you to move around
-The room is clean, spacious, minimalistic, overlooking the best nature view of Sapa (from the balcony and the bathroom). The best thing in Pao.
-Food: Over my expectation for a hotel. Usually, hotel's food isn't good as local restaurants but Pao changed my mind. Delicious but isn't expensive.
-Staff: Really supportive and friendly. Feeling comfortable staying here
-Spa: quite good, got an 20% off (I don't know why haha)

review.rating: Would have been a more comfortable stay if it wasnâ€™t that boost
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Cá»• Äiá»ƒn GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n
review.comment_positive: view on the valley, location just outside the noisy center.  Staff very helpfull and especially Katie.
review.comment_negative: very thin walls and with loud Chinese/ Vietnamese neighbours next to your room it can become quite annoying !!

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n NhÃ¬n ra Thung lÅ©ng
review.comment_positive:
- the view is really nice
- the room is big
- there were so kind to bring us something to eat even dough we ordered right at the time when the kitchen closes
review.comment_negative:
- not a lot vegan options for breakfast, even if they confirmed they will organize more during our stay
- the check in could be more friendly
- as a 5 star hotel you could organize a fruit bowl or similar as a welcome gift for the guests (so then they would have something to eat even if they arrive as late as we did (delay with the bus).)
- the regulation sheet has a lot of things listed what not to do and what fines wait if they are still commited. F.e. being loud. 1. Its nog really welcoming 2. This should be valid for the hotel too, on the second night, shortly before mid night a team came and started cleaning some bugs with loud machines. This is not acceptable, since there was no info for the guests, else the time chosen for this was just strange?
- the hotel seems to have a bug problem..when we arrived there were more than 8 flying bugs in the room, i guess they are coming out from the bathroom. In times of corona this is not understandable (low bookings, 5 star hotel and having a bug problem and not solving it is not ok)
- we reserved a bike at the reception for a ride (about 5 hours), we paid abour 230'000 this us really much for the condition the bike was in. The funny thing was that the lady at the desk said to make sure to put on the helmet, but arrived at the bike I was not able since the helmet closure was broken, so I had to hold it all the time
- we wanted to use the pool, came there, it was closed, ok waited till somebody opened. Then once in the water we recognized different bugs dead in the water.. again dirty impression for a 5 star.
- also we were distrubed a few times with no reason, the door bell was ringing and once we opened we saw some staff who just walked away with no communication. The same in the night, were other guests tried to open our door. This is also a misterious thing, when they have just a few guests in the hotel like in our case, why not devide them in seperate sides of the hotel, instead of having them grouped door to...

review.comment_negative: Just a suggestion to increase the frequency of the shuttle bus which goes to sapa town during the mornings and evenings. The shuttle bus runs every 2 hrs..so if you miss..you need to wait for 2 hr or take a taxi back to the hotel..

review.comment_positive: The proper was very well located and close to the town center and the shuttles were quite convenient even though they were every two hours instead of one like many other hotels. The views from the bar area during sunset were really nice too.
review.comment_negative:
- last shuttle is at 8:30 pm which is such an odd time because itâ€™s right in the middle of dinner time so you have to plan meticulously or just walk it like we did most times on our way back 
- pillows in the rooms are way too high and uncomfortable 
- the drinks at the bar are horrible (both coffee and cocktails). I got the fresh orange juice and it felt like the powdered orange juice with a bit of pulp and when I asked them to give me room temperature they just heated it in the microwave so it was super hot and was gross 
- the pool area looks nice in photos but is in another side of the building in a basement type of location so it feels very dingy in real life and super damp smell
- the bathrooms were not super clean and felt quite icky 
- the balconyâ€™s in the rooms facing the valley could do with some work. A lot of it was just a patch of mud and not so nice to look at 
- room service coffee was not good.

review.comment_positive:
Paoâ€˜s Sapa liegt etwas auÃŸerhalb von Sapa, wobei die Lage ein Pluspunkt ist. Die Anlage ist sehr modern, sauber und das Personal ist sehr freundlich.

Das FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck war gut und reichhaltig, wir haben auch nachmittags im Restaurant gegessen (Empfehlung: das Banh Mi mit Pommes) sowie die Happy Hour fÃ¼r Cocktails genutzt (sehr lecker!).

Die Tipps von den Mitarbeitenden waren sehr hilfreich, das Hotel ist schick, der Shuttle-Service war gut - wir wÃ¼rden wieder hier buchen!

Pao's Sapa is located just outside Sapa, although the location is a plus point. The facility is very modern, clean and the staff is very friendly.

The breakfast was good and plentiful, we also ate in the restaurant in the afternoon (recommendation: the Banh Mi with fries) and used the happy hour for cocktails (very tasty!).

The tips from the staff were very helpful, the hotel is chic - we would book here again!
review.comment_negative:
Wir waren im Februar wÃ¤hrend dichten Nebels in Sapa; um die Zeit im Hotel zu verbringen, waren uns Restaurant und Lobby ein wenig zu zugig (was auch daran lag, dass kurz vor unserer Ankunft die groÃŸe EingangstÃ¼r beschÃ¤digt wurde und deshalb fehlte, wofÃ¼r das Hotel natÃ¼rlich nichts kann). 

Vom Abendessen waren wir nicht so richtig Ã¼berzeugt; es war vergleichsweise teuer und das Essen war anders als erwartet (statt gebratener Nudeln kamen Nudeln in sÃ¼ÃŸ-saurer Sauce). 

We were in Sapa in February during thick fog; the restaurant and lobby were a little too draughty for us to spend time in the hotel (which was also due to the fact that the large entrance door was damaged shortly before our arrival and was therefore missing, for which the hotel is of course not responsible). 

We were not really convinced by the dinner; it was comparatively expensive and the food was different than expected (instead of fried noodles, we had noodles in sweet and sour sauce).

review.comment_positive:
The property is gorgeous perched on a hill. You won't get nicer views in Sapa. It's quiet away from the hustle and bustle of the town, you actually feel like you are in with nature.

The rooms were nice and spacious and the window seat was a delight. The balcony overlooking the valley was the highlight to wake up every morning in the clouds was a dream.

The staff were so kind and attentive to our needs. We really felt like they knew us personally. They helped us secure tickets to Fansipan as well.

The breakfast buffet had plenty of choice and was very tasty.  The pool was phenomenal. It was warm and had beautiful views.

The shuttle into town was also very convenient to use and helpful.

Everything was just amazing. We didnâ€™t think weâ€™d be able to come here but so glad we did.
The staff are brilliant, they canâ€™t do enough for you and provided us with all the information and support we needed.
The room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast selection was good.
The location is great too, offering a shuttle bus in to Sa Pa town every 2hrs, but we also walked back to the hotel as itâ€™s only 12-15 minutes. 
The gym was excellent, on the small side but offered nice techno gym equipment and decent weight selection. 
The value for the money was just brilliant and you canâ€™t forget about the views.

review.comment_positive: Loved everything about this place. Its very modern with big, big rooms and most importantly it's spotlessly clean.  The breakfast buffet is enormous even the most picky eater will find something to their liking. The staff are so incredibly helpful and friendly. A word the the dinner menu its great and dishes are beautifully presented, great taste too. The hotel is located about a ten minute walk from the centre and the hotel offer a free shuttle bus to the square throughout the day. It's a surprisingly lively town which was evident from the noise rolling down the hill late in the evening. Grateful to be at a distance from it and able to get a great night's sleep. In addition to all the great things this hotel has to offer it has the absolute best views out over the valley.

review.comment_positive: A really large room in this very large hotel.  From the staff who greet you to the staff who are looking after the pool excellent service is their aim.  The hotel itself is situated about a 10 minute walk down/up hill from the centre of Sapa which is lovely.  Unfortunately the weather was very misty so the view was somewhat obscured.  The restaurant and lobby areas are very spacious and comfortable.  Breakfast was a buffet and full of tasty food, Vietnamese and Western with a hot food station for freshly made omelettes, pho etc.  The pool area was lovely, again the staff were on hand to give towel etc.  the hotel offers a shuttle service to the centre of Sapa every two hours.  We used this to go up to the town and walked back.  There is a lovely bar on the 8th floor and a pool table if the weather was good. I would thoroughly recommend the hotel for a visit.  Really beautiful.

review.rating: Amazing hotel with great staff, views and food.
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n NhÃ¬n ra Thung lÅ©ng
review.comment_positive:
The property is gorgeous sitting on the side of a cliff. You will have amazing views from the restaurant/breakfast area. The staff reception staff including Katy (Lieu I believe) are awesome! On the day we arrived, we got there several hours before check-in time. After my wife spoke with them the first time, they remembered our names and would say hi to us every time we walked by and asked if we needed any assistance. They were also able to check us in early and upgrade our room without any problems or hesitation. It seemed they went above and beyond in many instances, and it really is amazing customer service to be treated like you're special when staying anywhere. We also appreciated that they gave us local recommendations and would inquire our plans for the day to give us other suggestions. It really felt that throughout all of Vietnam, the customer service is far superior to what we've experienced at most places in the US.
We also really enjoyed the breakfast that was included in our rate. There was a great variety of options (everything from traditional Vietnamese dishes to American options, and more). We loved sitting in the restaurant and enjoying the gorgeous views. The staff was always kind and helpful. The coffee was delicious too!
Another thing to mention that we appreciated was the location. Pao's would be considered a bit off the beaten path, but for anyone seeking serenity in the mountains, this is an ideal place to stay. The hotel is directly next to Moana Sapa, which is a big tourist attraction. We walked down to Cat Cat Village one day (it's not a very long walk, but a little hard with traffic and the turns). We also walked frequently to and from the busier area (downtown Sapa?). It's a short walk up a hill to get in, and easy to come back down. We enjoyed having peace and quiet, less light pollution, and crazy views vs. being in town by all the action.
review.comment_negative: The pool area could be better as there is condensation everywhere. The hotel is really missing on an opportunity as the pool has great views, but the area doesn't feel as inviting as the rest of the hotel.

review.rating: Beautifully designed hotel, very relaxing stay!
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n NhÃ¬n ra Thung lÅ©ng
review.comment_positive: This is a fantastic hotel, it's beautifully designed with cultural accents throughout reflecting the local area and people. We absolutely loved our room, lovely layout with a nice sized balcony and bathroom. The bed was very comfortable and the room exceptionally clean. We felt very relaxed here. Food was great, the breakfast buffet was amazing and replenished well, even almost at the end of breakfast time. Staff were very helpful, attentive and welcoming, with good English. Nice indoor pool. We had room service a few nights, and it was very good. There is a shuttle service to Sapa town, which you have to book at least 20 minutes in advance, it goes at particular times in the day. It's about a 20-30 minute walk into town which is not too strenuous, but the shuttle is a nice option.
review.comment_negative:
Our rooms location was just above reception, so we could unfortunately hear the children's play area from our room at times, but it was otherwise very quiet. 

We booked the return shuttle with the concierge team, from Sapa town to the hotel, but the minibus wasn't there at the agreed time. We contacted the hotel and there was a lot of confusion, but they said someone was on their way. We called them again, and they said traffic was too bad to get to us (It was very busy with traffic jams on side streets) so they said to get a taxi and the hotel will pay for our journey, the receptionist was very helpful and our journey was paid for when we got there, but we had been waiting in the rain for almost an hour after a busy day, so it was quite frustrating. We do appreciate that the hotel was able to help us in the end, and despite this we would definitely stay here again.

review.comment_positive: It's located right outside of town and takes about 15 minutes to walk to the main square. There is a free shuttle that will take you there and back every two hours if you don't want to walk. I think almost all the rooms have views of the mountain valley. We booked a classic room but still had our own balcony and mountain views. Breakfast was very good with lots of options definitely lives up to the five star vibe. The room was very spacious as well and large bathroom.
review.comment_negative: The walls were very thin. We were in a connected room and could hear almost everything that was going on in the opposite room. At night you can faintly hear the piano music coming from the hallway. There is also a night light in the bathroom that does not turn off unless you switch the master light off at the main door which isn't ideal since it turns off your ability to switch lights off anywhere else.

review.rating: Great value for money at Pao's Sapa Leisure Hotel
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Cá»• Äiá»ƒn GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n
review.comment_positive:
The view of the room was stunning, probably one of the best features of the place. 
The room is very spacious and well equipped with everything you need for a getaway in Sapa. 
The staff were very helpful and put their best efforts to ensure we had a wonderful stay, helping out with advise on what to do around Sapa, accommodating early luggage storage as well. 

Facilities wise, we tried up the heated indoors pool, which is very nice, especially after spending a full day in the cold wet weather outside.
review.comment_negative:
We have requested for early check in on the morning of arrival (very late request from our side), which unfortunately was not something that could be accommodated.
While it was a very late request from our side, it would have been great to be available, but by no means a deal breaker. 
We loved the place. 

Facilities wise, it would have been nice to have access to a dry sauna within the hotel, unfortunately not available.

review.rating: Harassed with messages and phone calls after my stay
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Premium GiÆ°á»ng ÄÃ´i/2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n NhÃ¬n Ra Thung LÅ©ng
review.comment_positive: Room was spacious and clean. Room service was quick. Bath tub was large and comfortable to use. Motorbike rental was available at the front desk (albeit at a 100% markup from rates at the town center). During our stay, staff were generally helpful and friendly.
review.comment_negative:
After rating the hotel 3 stars on Booking.com, I received a barrage of Whatsapp messages and phone calls from the hotel staff, which I found highly inappropriate and intrusive. This has led me to revise my rating to 2 stars. Reasons for my initial 3 star rating below:

- The hotel's air conditioning emitted a smoky odor, resulting in sore throats and illness for my family. The room's ventilation design (toilet doors were meshed and not solid), coupled with a strong bathroom dehumidifier, created an uncomfortably dry environment in the whole room.

- The pool was in poor condition, appearing dirty and smelling unpleasant, with visible mold around the area. It was nothing like the photos. Additionally, the gym was small and overlooking the entrance car park, with close to zero privacy.

- During check-in, I was offered a complimentary Christmas Eve dinner, confirmed by multiple staff members. However, at checkout, I was unexpectedly billed VND 1.4 million for the meal. Although the charge was eventually dropped, the situation was unpleasant.

- While completing a feedback form during checkout, I felt pressured by the staff, who scrutinized my responses and questioned my ratings.

- Paying VND 18.3 million for a 3-night stay in Sapa (USD 250 / night), I expected higher service standards and better facilities. The post-stay harassment by the hotel further deteriorated my overall experience.

review.comment_positive: Our stay at Pao's Sapa Leisure Hotel was nothing short of magical. Surrounded by misty mountains and terraced rice fields, the hotel's ambiance was enchanting. The rooms were cozy, offering stunning views of the Sapa Valley, while the staff's warm hospitality made us feel at home. The hotel's spa and wellness facilities provided a relaxing escape after days of exploring. With delicious local cuisine and thoughtful amenities, Pao's Sapa Leisure Hotel truly captured the essence of Sapa's natural beauty and offered an unforgettable experience. We left rejuvenated and utterly charmed

The staff at Pao's were very friendly, helpful and sincere. I escaped here for my birthday and was surprised by a cake and well wishes on the day.  A very unexpected and personal touch.

The location is a short walk from central Sapa town, with fabulous views over the valley and surrounding countryside. 

The room and facilities were spotlessly clean and tidy, and the restaurant was amazing.

I would highly recommend.

A special mention to Front Office Manager Mr Nguyen Duc Thinh for making me feel very welcome and for sharing his local knowledge.

review.comment_positive: We've been very lucky to get a free upgrade to a Deluxe Double. The balcony in the room was nice to view sunset at your own space. The hotel provides a stunning view of Sapa. review.comment_positive:
We absolutely loved our stay at Pao's. It looks exactly like the photos (which is not always the case), was very comfortable and all the staff were lovely. We had originally stayed for 3 nights, and ended up extending an extra 9 because it was such a nice place to base ourselves. The value for money was second to none.
Views over the valley from the balcony were outstanding. The desk in the room had plenty of space to work, and there were common seating areas if you wanted to have a change of scenery. 
The breakfast buffet had something for everyone. We also utilized the gym quite a bit (the full set of dumbells was great).
We had originally thought it may have been a little far away, but the walk to town is actually very easy. They also have the free shuttle that runs basically every 2 hours, or you can just take a paid electric vehicle from the door.
